question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
Write the following expression as a polynomial: $$(2x^2+3x+7)(x+1)-(x+1)(x^2+4x-63)+(3x-14)(x+1)(x+5).$$
inference:
Solution:
We start by expanding the first two products:
\begin{align*}
&(2x^2+3x+7)(x+1)-(x+1)(x^2+4x-63)+(3x-14)(x+1)(x+5) \\
&\qquad= 2x^3 + 2x^2 + 3x^2 + 3x + 7x + 7 - (x^3 + 4x^2 - 63x + x^2 + 4x - 63) \\
&\qquad\qquad+ (3x-14)(x+1)(x+5).
\end{align*}Combining like terms, we get
\begin{align*}
&(2x^3 + 2x^2 + 3x^2 + 3x + 7x + 7 - (x^3 + 4x^2 - 63x + x^2 + 4x - 63) \\
&\qquad\qquad+ (3x-14)(x+1)(x+5) \\
&\qquad= x^3 + x^2 + 67x + 70 + (3x-14)(x+1)(x+5).
\end{align*}Now we expand the remaining product:
\begin{align*}
&x^3 + x^2 + 67x + 70 + (3x-14)(x+1)(x+5) \\
&\qquad = x^3 + x^2 + 67x + 70 + (3x-14)(x^2 + 6x + 5) \\
&\qquad = x^3 + x^2 + 67x + 70 + (3x^3 + 18x^2 + 15x - 14x^2 - 84x - 70) \\
&\qquad = x^3 + x^2 + 67x + 70 + 3x^3 + 4x^2 - 69x - 70.
\end{align*}Finally, combining like terms again, we obtain
\begin{align*}
&x^3 + x^2 + 67x + 70 + 3x^3 + 4x^2 - 69x - 70 \\
&\qquad = \boxed{4x^3 + 5x^2 - 2x}.
\end{align*}Final Answer: $\boxed{4x^3 + 5x^2 - 2x}$. I hope it is correct.

question:
Solution:
We start by expanding the first two products:
\begin{align*}
&(2x^2+3x+7)(x+1)-(x+1)(x^2+4x-63)+(3x-14)(x+1)(x+5) \\
&\qquad= 2x^3 + 2x^2 + 3x^2 + 3x + 7x + 7 - (x^3 + 4x^2 - 63x + x^2 + 4x - 63) \\
&\qquad\qquad+ (3x-14)(x+1)(x+5).
\end{align*}Combining like terms, we get
\begin{align*}
&(2x^3 + 2x^2 + 3x^2 + 3x + 7x + 7 - (x^3 + 4x^2 - 63x + x^2 + 4x - 63) \\
&\qquad\qquad+ (3x-14)(x+1)(x+5) \\
&\qquad= x^3 + x^2 + 67x + 70 + (3x-14)(x+1)(x+5).
\end{align*}Now we expand the remaining product:
\begin{align*}
&x^3 + x^2 + 67x + 70 + (3x-14)(x+1)(x+5) \\
&\qquad = x^3 + x^2 + 67x + 70 + (3x-14)(x^2 + 6x + 5) \\
&\qquad = x^3 + x^2 + 67x + 70 + (3x^3 + 18x^2 + 15x - 14x^2 - 84x - 70) \\
&\qquad = x^3 + x^2 + 67x + 70 + 3x^3 + 4x^2 - 69x - 70.
\end{align*}Finally, combining like terms again, we obtain
\begin{align*}
&x^3 + x^2 + 67x + 70 + 3x^3 + 4x^2 - 69x - 70 \\
&\qquad = \boxed{4x^3 + 5x^2 - 2x}.
\end{align*}Final Answer: $\boxed{4x^3 + 5x^2 - 2x}$. I hope it is correct.
